title: Exploiting epigenetic variation for plant breeding

title_detail.value: Exploiting epigenetic variation for plant breeding

summary: Epigenetic changes can bring about new traits without altering the sequence of genes. This may allow plants to respond quicker to changes in their environment. Plant biologists have now demonstrated that epigenetic variation is also subject to selection and can be inherited. This could expand the possibilities for crop breeding.
